decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan using counterspells and targeted discard spells, while also generating advantage through creature removal and card advantage. It aims to control the board with Faeries and disruptive spells, while gradually draining the opponent's life total with Bitterblossom. The deck also has a strong mana base to support its spells and utilizes powerful Faerie creatures such as Vendilion Clique and Mistbind Clique to apply pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling the Splinter Twin combo of either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite with Splinter Twin to create an infinite token generating engine. The deck also includes control elements such as Remand, Cryptic Command, and Dispel to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Snapcaster Mage provides value by allowing spells to be recast from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board while setting up the combo to win the game in a burst of explosive damage.

The focus of this aggressive Modern Red Deck Wins archetype is to rapidly deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and powerful creatures. With a low mana curve and a high density of direct damage spells, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure early in the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for playing spells, further amplifying the deck's strategy of quickly overwhelming the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to quickly set up and maximize the use of Pyromancer Ascension to double the effectiveness of spells. By casting numerous cantrips such as Sleight of Hand and Gitaxian Probe, the deck aims to fill the graveyard with flashback spells like Past in Flames. This allows the player to chain together a series of rituals and card draw spells to generate a large storm count, before finishing off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot. The deck focuses on efficiently generating mana and drawing through the deck to assemble the combo pieces for a explosive victory.

The main focus of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence of powerful Merfolk creatures supported by lords to boost their abilities. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as counterspells and bounce spells to control the opponent's board while maintaining aggression. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy to win the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, adding to the deck's speed and efficiency.

The deck focuses on a combination of hand disruption, removal, and powerful threats to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil provide card advantage and disruption, while Tarmogoyf and Lingering Souls serve as aggressive threats. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing cards like Scavenging Ooze for graveyard hate. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive gameplay, with a focus on consistency and flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using Faerie creatures and powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Bitterblossom and Mistbind Clique to generate tokens and bounce permanents, along with counterspells like Remand and Cryptic Command, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's tempo and gain advantage over time. With cards like Vendilion Clique and Time Warp to provide card advantage and extra turns, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a game of attrition.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption to control the board while deploying powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to quickly close out games. It also includes cards like Anger of the Gods to handle aggressive creature decks and planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Pyromaster to generate card advantage and additional pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of disruption and efficient threats. It aims to control the board with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while using powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing control spells to disrupt their game plan. By playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Spells like Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command provide removal and flexibility to deal with threats and stall the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent, utilizing low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures to overwhelm them before they can establish a strong board presence. The deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent, using efficient removal spells and direct damage to control the game and secure a win. By maintaining a fast-paced, aggressive strategy, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively, punishing opponents who are unable to keep up with its relentless onslaught.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through countermagic, removal spells, and tempo plays. It utilizes creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel to generate value from instants and sorceries, while also providing a clock for the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all colors of mana, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. By managing resources effectively and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in a grindy midrange battle.

The key concept of this Aggro-Affinity Modern deck is centered around a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum, Mox Opal, and Cranial Plating, the deck aims to quickly power up creatures like Vault Skirge, Signal Pest, and Arcbound Ravager to deal damage swiftly. Ensoul Artifact and Steel Overseer provide additional ways to enhance your creatures, while cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Galvanic Blast offer flexibility in both attacking and removing threats. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of powerful threats and efficient mana usage.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Leonin Arbiter, and Aven Mindcensor to slow down opponents and disrupt their mana base. Restoration Angel and Flickerwisp provide additional value by flickering key creatures or lands. The combination of disruption and aggression aims to control the pace of the game and limit opponents' options, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of attrition and damage output.

The deck focuses on quickly amassing artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Galvanic Blast to deal damage efficiently. By using cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Signal Pest, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of flying and infect damage. The inclusion of cards like Etched Champion and Steel Overseer provide protection and boost the power of the artifact creatures. Overall, this deck aims to win the game quickly by utilizing the synergy between artifacts and aggro strategies.

This deck focuses on the combo of using Splinter Twin to enchant Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite, creating an infinite number of hasty token creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck contains cards for control and removal, as well as card draw to find the necessary combo pieces. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the player to set up the combo quickly and efficiently. The key strategy is to protect the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately winning through a quick and powerful combo finish.
